What products can be covered by Arm Technical Support?
All Arm products can be covered by Technical Support.

How long can I take out Technical Support for a product?
Technical Support can be taken out in line with the term of your product license.

If you have not received a renewal email, send us a message.

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.

How do I get the best out of support cases?

To open a support case, access the Arm Support Hub using your Arm ID login details. Then follow these steps: Select ‘Raise case’. Search the content to see if your question has already been answered in a technical document, blog or knowledge base article (KBA). You may get an immediate answer to your query this way. If your query was not answered by our existing content, select ‘Continue to open a case’. Select the case type and enter the product(s) you are enquiring about.

What information should I provide when raising a support case?
Include any environment details and attachments. Be responsive to requests for further information.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Are there any limits on support?

With valid entitlement, there are no limits on the number of questions, who asks the questions, or the topic, as long as it is reasonably related to the product. There is a 16-hour limit on the effort Arm spends on an individual case before requiring a management review of the case.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Can I ask questions in my local language?

Our global team of support engineers can answer questions raised in English or Chinese. They can endeavor to address questions in other languages, but answers may be delayed due to the need for translation.

What are the support hours?
Arm technical support operates on a 24/5 global schedule, providing service Monday through Friday across regions. Support includes anything from timely case updates to resolution.

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What is the telephone number for support? How can I speak to a human?

To contact a support engineer, open a case using the Support Hub via the Arm website. If you want to request to have a live conversation, indicate that you would like a phone discussion in your case description when submitting your issue. A regional support engineer will then schedule a call with you. Support Hub

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
How do I submit a complaint?
To escalate or formally lodge a complaint, please contact your sales account manager. If your inquiry relates to an open case, you can reply directly on your case and request an escalation.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
How can I get a quicker response on my support ticket?

Arm Support Hub allows you to: Select the appropriate priority level when opening a case. The recommended usage is as follows: Critical: Production stop issue or an issue that impacts the performance of a production device or system that is currently in production. Urgent: An issue that is likely to cause a notable delay or disruption to your project timeline. Normal: Standard support question with no or low immediate impact to your schedule. Select the appropriate priority level Critical: Production stop issue or an issue that impacts the performance of a production device or system that is currently in production. Provide comprehensive details (e.g., logs, steps to reproduce). Provide comprehensive details Request a callback from a technical engineer on the case. The system is monitored globally 24/5, ensuring responsive handling once your case is opened. Request a callback

How can I contact sales?

To reach sales, go to the Contact Us page on arm.com . You can submit a form there covering licensing, pricing, and more. To learn more about Arm support and training options, or Arm professional services, use this form .

You are a technology expert. Provide clear, detailed, and accurate technical information.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Why Arm Design Reviews?

Our premium expert review service, Arm Design Reviews, helps you optimize your Arm-based system on chip (SoC) designs, using advice from the most experienced Arm engineers in the industry. Arm Design Reviews boost your Arm technology expertise and help your team design effectively to launch products quickly without risking quality.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What is the difference between an Arm Design Review and an Arm Design Checklist?

Design Reviews are delivered by Arm experts either remotely or live, and are only available to selected partners as an add-on option. Arm Design Checklists are available to any partners who have a valid license for the IP or who have an Arm Flexible Access or Arm Total Access subscription.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in product. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
How do I access the Design Checklists?

You can access the Design Checklists on the Product Download Hub , on the Documentation Hub , or on IP Explorer . You will need a valid Arm Account ( Register here ) and a valid license for the IP covered in the checklists. For more details on how to access the Design Checklists watch this video .

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in product. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What distinguishes Design Reviews from training or support?

Support and training explain what an Arm product can do and how to integrate it. Design Reviews cover all the Arm products in your implementation to help ensure they are used correctly and in line with your design goals.

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Why do I need a Design Reviews agreement before the first engagement starts?
The agreement is required to cover the information disclosed during an engagement.

You are a customer support agent with a positive tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What happens when I have a Design Review?

For a Design Review, there are three stages: Preparation, on-site visit, and report. For an Implementation Review, the visit is replaced by an off-site review involving a series of conference calls. The preparation stage is necessary in both cases to ensure the best use of time in the main review phase.

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
How long does a Design Review engagement last?

Assuming the Design Review agreement is in place, an engagement can start within a few weeks of the request. The length of the engagement varies depending on the type of Design Review service, which typically takes three to four days on-site. An Implementation Review is conducted over a period of months. The report is published two weeks after the engagement has concluded.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What information does the Design Review report contain?
The Design Review report provides a summary of the project, together with a detailed account of the issues, recommendations, and observations made during the review.

You are a customer support agent with a neutral tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What products can be covered by a Design Review?

Design Reviews are restricted to Arm products at EAC or later. The preparation stage of the Design Review identifies which products you are using and ensures the right experts are assigned. Contact us to discuss any special requirements.

You are a customer support agent with a positive tone. Your expertise is in product. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Who delivers a Design Review?

Design Reviews are delivered by senior Arm engineers from the product support team, or engineers from the product development team, chosen for their relevant knowledge and experience, and backed up by the product support team.

You are a customer support agent with a positive tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
What guarantees does Arm make?

Arm cannot guarantee that a Design Review will produce perfectly working silicon. Arm cannot guarantee that an Implementation Review will exceed PPA targets. Arm can ensure that a design is thoroughly inspected by Arm experts who have worked with many successful designs.

You are a customer support agent with a enthusiastic tone. Your expertise is in support. Provide clear, accurate, and helpful answers to user questions.
Keep answers concise, structured (bullets/steps), and grounded in known facts; if uncertain, say so briefly.
Why Arm Support?

"My queries were answered by a very reactive and competent team, in particular for such new products as the HPC Compiler and SVE emulator." "The turnaround time for the problem resolution was excellent. You guys root-caused the problem and got to the solution very quickly. It beat my expectations considering the weekend and the timezone differences." "The feedback was very helpful because it contained enough documents and explanations, where we could derive answers for our queries. Thank you for the detailed information and kind support." "The answer I received was exactly the right response. It explained the because of my issue and clearly identified what I needed to do." "As usual, response from Arm Support was rapid and helpful." "You saved me a working day on a time critical period and for that I am grateful. Thank you very much."
